Class DiscreteFourierTransform

java.lang.Object
org.jscience.mathematics.analysis.transform.DiscreteFourierTransform
All Implemented Interfaces:
Function<Vector<Complex>, Vector<Complex>>, Bijection<Vector<Complex>, Vector<Complex>>, ContinuousFunction<Vector<Complex>, Vector<Complex>>, DifferentiableFunction<Vector<Complex>, Vector<Complex>>, Function<Vector<Complex>, Vector<Complex>>, Relation<Vector<Complex>, Vector<Complex>>, Transform<Vector<Complex>, Vector<Complex>>, VectorFunction<Complex>
public class DiscreteFourierTransform extends Object implements Transform<Vector<Complex>, Vector<Complex>>, VectorFunction<Complex>
Discrete Fourier Transform (DFT) using Fast Fourier Transform (FFT) algorithm.

Maps a vector of N complex numbers (time domain) to N complex numbers (frequency domain).

Since:
1.0
Author:
Silvere Martin-Michiellot, Gemini AI (Google DeepMind)

  • Method Details

    • outputDimension

      public int outputDimension()
      Returns the output dimension. For DFT, output dimension equals input. This is only known at evaluation time, so we return -1 to indicate dynamic.
      Specified by:
      outputDimension in interface VectorFunction<Complex>
      Returns:
      m where f: F^n -> F^m

    • jacobian

      public Matrix<Complex> jacobian(Vector<Complex> point)
      Description copied from interface: VectorFunction
      Calculates the Jacobian matrix at the given point. J_ij = d(f_i)/d(x_j) Default implementation uses central difference approximation if F is Real.
      Specified by:
      jacobian in interface VectorFunction<Complex>
      Parameters:
      point - the point at which to evaluate the Jacobian
      Returns:
      the Jacobian matrix (m x n)
